title: Thunderbird Spell Check
content:
I have just come back to Thunderbird after a hiatus of several years.

I have installed a dictionary but there is no way to select it so the spell check does not work. There used to be an option in the form of a drop down box that was in both the settings and in pop up box in composition when you went to check the spelling but that is no longer there.

As a result, the spell check does not work.
creator: dixoncmark

title: Manu Márquez
content: Puedo enviar correos cuando los redacto, pero no puedo reenviar o responder correos recibidos, aparece el cuadro de dialogo de envío y se oculta inmediatamente sin ejecutar la acción. No puedo enviar imágenes ya que no me presenta ningún mensaje de error.
creator: sosegao4

title: Calendario Outlook
content: Buongiorno, uso Firefox quotidianamente a lavoro e vorrei usare anche thunderbird a livello lavorativo. Il problema è che ha una grande pecca rispetto all'applicazione "Outlook", ovvero che, a quanto sembra, non esiste un supporto diretto push all'account outlook. In particolare sono riuscito a collegare la mia mail, ma per quanto riguarda il calendario niente da fare, non riesco a vederlo se non usando un'estensione chiamata "Tbsync" che però è scomoda in quanto non sempre funzione e inoltre devo procedere manualmente alla sincronizzazione ogni volta. Davvero non esiste un modo migliore per avere la sincronizzazione push del mio account outlook? Sarebbe un vero peccato non poter usare la vostra applicazione per questo, spero ci sia una soluzione. Buona giornata. Marco
creator: marco.califano

title: Linea separatore nella email
content:
E' possibile inserire in modo automatico una linea di separazione tra le email, come in Outlook?

Grazie, Giuseppe
creator: giuseppe.figlie

title: No Subject column in one particular Inbox folder
content:
After one of the recent updates my list of e-mails on the affected folder (Inbox) suddenly went blank, I could only highlight the rows by hovering the mouse over them. Then, my Subject column totally disappeared. I've tried all solutions that I've managed to find on the Internet: Reinstall, Repair unified view, Apply columns to – everything to no avail. There's no Subject column to tick in the RMB column view. Every other acc works just fine, even every folder other than Inbox on the affected account works perfectly fine.

I'm really in a pickle right now, I have all my work-related e-mails on that account, everything sorted, labelled etc and I cannot afford to lose that. Is there a way to fix it or revert to previous TB releases? Thanks in advance.
creator: matgrzybowski1

title: lost all my folders again last time lost al my contacts
content: I opened my PC desktop yesterday went in to Thunderbird and again I have an issue either it update or whatever. I have lost all my folder and another time I lost all my contact. I did not update the version so do not know what has happened. This happens so many times and plays up. I have used Thunderbird as I believe its the best and the layout is brilliant but I need help restoring what I have lost back. Please help
creator: eileen.forde8

title: José Luis
content: En el correo en la lista de carpetas tengo muchas carpetas/archivos con los nombre de Archivo, Destacados, Crash que van seguidas de muchos ceros y quiero eliminarlas pero no me deja.
creator: quico_quico

title: Lost email content during a sending process. The connection failed and I click unfortunately on don't save button
content: Hello Is it possible to find a email written but not saved. During the sending I had a connection issue. It asked me to save or not but I was not concentrated and I clicked on don't save button. Is there somewhere a temporarily memory where I can rescue it ? It was a mistake but the email was very long. I can't believe to have lost everything ;-((( Thanks
creator: giovannino57

title: Thunderbird has stopped working.
content: Thunderbird suddenly stopped loading, it just says thunderbird has encountered a problem after a very long wait I have tried reinstalling it with no success and I have tried asking for help. Any suggestions?
creator: keith.elmer

title: Move old 20.0.24 version address book and emails to 102.7.2 version
content:
Been using Thunderbird version 20.0.24 since winxp days. Moved it to win10 laptop and it worked for many years until that laptop would not boot any more. The 102.7.2 version of Thunderbird would not use the old profile because the control file extensions changed. Have a 102.7.2 Thunderbird installed and working fine now with newly created profile and accounts.

I have a backup copy of the 20.0.24 version profile. Now I would like to move the data in the 20.0.24 version address book and old emails to the 102.7.2 version of Thunderbird. Is that possible to do?
creator: jjbarbish

title: Inbox server full
content: How can i emtpty my server inbox as its full?
creator: info8739

title: Certain emails cause Thunderbird to get stuck downloading them
content:
Certain emails cause Thunderbird to hang with "Downloading message [number] of [number]" displayed in the status bar. The attempt and status bar text goes away after a while, and that email and the ones after it are not downloaded. Next time you get messages, it gets stuck at "Downloading message 1 of [number]" so you know it's the same email causing the issue. I'm using 102.4 on windows 10.

Other people have encountered and asked about this before. Based on the responses, I've tried:

- Deleting global-messages-db.sqlite. Did not work. - Deleting popstate.dat. Did not work. - Turning of Windows Defender real time protection. Did not work. - Allowing Thunderbird firewall access. Did not work.

Something that does work is deleting that email on the server. A response marked as solution was to log on to the webmail and delete that email. In my situation there is no webmail and I have asked sysads to delete that email which has worked, but I cannot repeatedly ask them to do so, so it's not a solution for me.

If someone would throw some light on this issue, it would be greatly appreciated.
creator: chengiz

title: In TB, how do I make the printer "system dialog" standard for all printing?
content: I reported long ago as a bug that Thunderbird (and Firefox) in my Ubuntu Studio 22.04 installation do not understand my printer's paper sizes. For a while I could get around this with the configuration option: print.tab_modal.enabled false because the system print dialog lists the appropriate sizes, but this no longer works. Now I have to first click the corresponding button in the Mozilla modal print dialog to select a standard paper size (e.g. A4) in the system print dialog. How can I suppress the useless modal print dialog and go directly to the system print dialog?
creator: rsbrux

title: Sending of the message failed: connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) failed
content:
Hi,

Today I'm having a problem with two of the four Outgoing servers I use. In both cases, I get the following Error Message:

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) <name.of.the.server> failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

I know that both servers are working because 1) I am the only one using them with this problem, 2) if I use the webmail application of both servers, I do not have the problem.

I tried the Safe Mode, but the problem persists.

I check the passwords and the Outgoing servers settings and they are all OK.

I restarted the computer (MacBook Air Retina, 13-inch, 2019).

What shall I do to fix the problem?

Thank you (More information below).

Detailed information:

My mail provider 1: office365.com My mail provider 2: mpg.de

ISP: mpg.de

No firewall (I guess)

No antivirus

Operating system and version: Mac OS Ventura 13.0.1

Thunderbird version: Thunderbird 102.8.0 (64-bit)

title: Thunderbird not working with Office 365 emails
content:
Unfortunatelly this thread was closed: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1294759

The mentioned thread was not helpfull for my current version of office365 and thunderbird 102.7.1 and the condition, that I'm working in a company behind a firewall.


I needed to perform further steps:

1. Import the certificate of my company (ask your company) into Thunderbird: Going to "Settings" -> "Privacy & Security" -> Scrolling down untill the button "Manage Certificates" is visible and clicking on the button "Manage Certificates". A window is opening, than clicking on the tab "Authorities". In this tab "Authorities" it's necessary to click "Import" to import the certificate of the company you are working in.

2. Setting up OAUTH2 for "Authentication" (for SMTP and IMAP both) during configuring your mailaccount in thunderbird. This two pages are giving useable step-by-step guides: - https://uwaterloo.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ISTKB/pages/290362068/How+to+setup+Microsoft+365+in+Thunderbird

- https://uit.stanford.edu/service/office365/configure/thunderbird-oauth2

Best regards!
creator: harifari548

title: Thunderbird Variables
content:
Hello, I am trying to add the Customer thermometer app to thunderbird, and it has a feature to collect email addresses and names, but I wasn't able to find Variables for thunderbird. Could you advise? Here is the quote from the Customer thermometer support team:

Thank you for getting in touch. That's ok! It really depends on if Thunderbird has variables/placeholders that represent the recipient's email.

In order for the recipient details to display within your reporting and the email notifications you first need to capture them. This would be done at the point that the email is sent, by including 'merge fields' or variables from your system that is sending the survey in the Thermometer code (in your case Thunderbird). It works in the same way that you might add a merge field to the body of an email to merge in the recipient's first name.

The fields will usually look something like: {email_address} or [First Name] - every system is different, but you should be able to find the relevant fields within Thunderbird. These fields need to be added during the Thermometer set-up process when generating your code.

title: Animated GIF in email signature
content:
Hi all,

I use Tbird on Mac. I want to use a simple animated gif in the html of my email signature - attached. For some reason this image wont load when I create a new message. When I test the gif by adding inline to the body of a message it works fine, which makes this perplexing. When I use a static version of the same image (hosted on same server) in my sig, it also works fine. The img path is valid: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0608/8812/1543/files/cay-skin-signature.gif

Does Thunderbird Mac OS block, or not permit, animated gifs in signatures? Why? Since the entire message of 

a Tbird email is one continuous html file I cant figure out how it could even do this.

Also attaching my signature code for reference.

ty to anyone who could help!

title: Thunderbird
content:
Thunderbird hangs when trying to send emails. It says it can't authenticate SMTP server or something to that extend. What is weird is that I can save an email in drafts, close Thunderbird, open Thunderbird, open the email and send it without a problem so there is no error with the username or password. I checked the SMTP server GMail settings and all seems to be in order.

It works without a problem for a while and then it looks like it goes into sleep mode or something and then doesn't wake up again. Problem is just with sending emails, downloading emails has no issues.
